ground_truth: He pushes Cahoon toward the door, and the hulking inmate follows close behind. Dillinger hides against a wall. Cahoon peaks through the bars. As the guard opens the door, Dillinger pushes Cahoon away and slams Brian into the wall. The hulking inmate covers Cahoon's mouth. Dillinger spins Brian to the next door, pointing the waxy weapon at his back. Brian refuses. Dillinger pokes Brian with the gun. He shoves Brian to his hulking accomplice, who still restrains Cahoon. Dillinger eyes the door. He kicks it open and hits the guard in the face. Max tumbles down a flight of stairs with Dillinger close behind. His accomplice holds a pipe in his raised hand as he pushes Brian behind Dillinger. Using Max's keys, Dillinger opens the next barred door then forces Max to stand in front of a metal door. The guard on the other side peeks through then unlocks it. As he opens the door, Dillinger shoves him into Max, and his accomplice hits Brian with his pipe. Dillinger rushes into the office and holds his gun to the warden's neck. He pushes the warden into the hall while his accomplice restrains a deputy. As Dillinger jams the barrel of his gun into the warden's neck, the warden spins the dial on a safe door. Dillinger steps into the closet-sized safe, discards his fake, waxy gun, and grabs a pistol from the wall. He steps out with a rifle and hands a machine gun to his accomplice. The warden glances back as the accomplice leads him away. Dillinger grabs a hat and coat from a nearby rack. He puts them on and tosses a jacket to the other inmate, who grabs a hat from the rack as he ushers the deputy out behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised, Dillinger cautiously opens a metal door in the hallway. His accomplice follows close behind with one hand clutching the deputy between them. They make their way into a garage where a mechanic works on a police car. Dillinger reaches into one of the cars and rips out its ignition wires. He strides to the Ford V8. Outside, four officers talk to each other on a porch, their guns perched casually against their shoulders. The sleek Ford passes undetected in the alley beside them. At the front of the jailhouse, the National Guardsmen mill about by their sandbag wall. As Dillinger drives through the town, he nervously shifts his eyes back under the tipped-down brim of his fedora. The jailhouse mechanic sits beside him while his accomplice rides in back with the deputy. Dillinger notices three National Guardsmen strolling down the sidewalk. He stops for a red traffic light on a corner where more National Guardsmen stand together talking, their guns strapped over their shoulders.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He thrusts Cahoon toward the entryway, and the massive prisoner trails close behind. Dillinger conceals against a partition. Cahoon peeks through the rods. As the sentinel unlocks the portal, Dillinger thrusts Cahoon aside and forces Brian into the barrier. The massive prisoner covers Cahoon's mouth. Dillinger twirls Brian to the subsequent portal, directing the waxen armament at his spine. Brian declines. Dillinger prods Brian with the firearm. He thrusts Brian to his massive cohort, who still restrains Cahoon. Dillinger regards the entryway. He kicks it ajar and strikes the sentinel in the visage. Max tumbles down a set of steps with Dillinger close behind. His cohort grips a pipe in his elevated hand as he thrusts Brian behind Dillinger. Using Max's keys, Dillinger unlocks the subsequent barred portal then compels Max to stand before a metallic entry. The sentinel on the opposite side peeks through then unlatches it. As he opens the portal, Dillinger thrusts him into Max, and his cohort strikes Brian with his pipe. Dillinger dashes into the office and holds his firearm to the warden's throat. He thrusts the warden into the corridor while his cohort restrains a deputy. As Dillinger jams the muzzle of his firearm into the warden's throat, the warden twirls the dial on a secure entry. Dillinger steps into the closet-sized vault, discards his mock, waxen firearm, and seizes a pistol from the partition. He steps out with a rifle and hands a machine gun to his cohort. The warden glances back as the cohort leads him away. Dillinger seizes a hat and overcoat from a nearby stand. He dons them and tosses a jacket to the other prisoner, who seizes a hat from the stand as he ushers the deputy out behind Dillinger. With his rifle elevated, Dillinger cautiously opens a metallic entry in the corridor. His cohort trails close behind with one hand gripping the deputy between them. They make their way into a garage where a mechanic labors on a police car. Dillinger reaches into one of the cars and tears out its ignition wires. He strides to the Ford V8. Outside, four officers converse with each other on a veranda, their firearms perched casually against their shoulders. The sleek Ford passes undetected in the alley beside them. At the forefront of the jailhouse, the National Guardsmen mill about by their sandbag barricade. As Dillinger drives through the town, he nervously shifts his gaze back beneath the tilted brim of his fedora. The jailhouse mechanic sits beside him while his cohort rides in the rear with the deputy. Dillinger notices three National Guardsmen strolling down the sidewalk. He halts for a red traffic signal on a corner where more National Guardsmen stand together conversing, their firearms strapped over their shoulders.

As the door is opened, he is shoved into Max by Dillinger, and Brian is hit with his pipe by his accomplice. The office is rushed into by Dillinger, and the gun is held to the warden's neck. Into the hall, the warden is pushed by him while the deputy is restrained by his accomplice. As the barrel of his gun is jammed into the warden's neck by Dillinger, the safe door is spun by the warden. Into the closet-sized safe, Dillinger steps, his fake, waxy gun is discarded, and a pistol is grabbed from the wall by him. With a rifle, he steps out and to his accomplice, a machine gun is handed. They are put on by him, and to the other inmate, a jacket is tossed by him, who from the rack grabs a hat as the deputy is ushered out behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised, a metal door in the hallway is cautiously opened by Dillinger. Close behind, his accomplice follows with one hand clutching the deputy between them. Into a garage, their way is made by them where a police car is worked on by a mechanic. Into one of the cars, Dillinger reaches and its ignition wires are ripped out by him. To the Ford V8, he strides. Outside, on a porch, four officers talk to each other, their guns casually perched against their shoulders. The alley beside them is passed undetected by the sleek Ford. By their sandbag wall, the National Guardsmen mill about at the front of the jailhouse. Through the town, Dillinger drives, and back under the tipped-down brim of his fedora, his eyes are nervously shifted. For a red traffic light on a corner, where more National Guardsmen stand together talking, their guns strapped over their shoulders, he stops.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Dillinger pushes Cahoon toward the door as a hulking inmate follows. He hides while Cahoon peeks through the bars. When the guard opens the door, Dillinger pushes Cahoon aside, slamming Brian into the wall. The inmate covers Cahoon's mouth as Dillinger forces Brian to the next door with a waxy weapon. Brian resists until Dillinger pokes him with the gun and shoves him to the hulking accomplice. Dillinger kicks open the door, hitting the guard. Max tumbles down stairs, followed by Dillinger. The accomplice, holding a pipe, pushes Brian to Dillinger. Dillinger uses Max's keys to open another door and forces Max to stand by a metal door. The opposite guard unlocks it, and Dillinger shoves him into Max as the accomplice strikes Brian. Dillinger holds a gun to the warden's neck, pushing him into the hall, while his accomplice restrains a deputy. Inside a safe, Dillinger discards a fake gun and grabs a pistol, rifle, and machine gun. He dons a hat and coat, tossing a jacket to the inmate. They move into the garage where a mechanic works on a police car. Dillinger removes ignition wires and approaches a Ford V8. Outside, unaware officers talk on a porch. The Ford slips by undetected. At the jail front, National Guardsmen loiter near a sandbag wall. Dillinger, nervous, watches under his fedora. The mechanic sits beside him, and the accomplice rides in the back with the deputy. Dillinger spots National Guardsmen on the sidewalk, stopping at a red light where more Guardsmen talk with guns slung over their shoulders.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He pushes Cahoon, the hulking inmate follows. Dillinger hides. Cahoon peeks through bars. As the guard opens the door, Dillinger pushes Cahoon aside and slams Brian into the wall. The inmate covers Cahoon's mouth. Dillinger spins Brian to the next door, pointing the waxy weapon. Brian refuses. Dillinger pokes him, shoving Brian to his accomplice, who restrains Cahoon. Dillinger eyes the door, kicks it, hitting the guard. Max tumbles down stairs, Dillinger follows. The accomplice holds a pipe, pushing Brian. Dillinger uses Max's keys, forces Max in front of a metal door. The other guard unlocks it. Dillinger shoves him into Max; the accomplice hits Brian with the pipe. Dillinger rushes in, holds his gun to the warden's neck, pushing him into the hall. His accomplice restrains a deputy. Dillinger forces the warden to open a safe. He discards his waxy gun, grabs a pistol, steps out with a rifle, hands a machine gun to his accomplice. The warden glances back as he's led away. Dillinger grabs a hat, coat, and tosses a jacket to the other inmate. He opens a metal door, followed by his accomplice clutching the deputy. They reach a garage. Dillinger removes car ignition wires, strides to the Ford V8. Outside, four officers talk, guns perched casually. The Ford passes undetected. National Guardsmen mill by a sandbag wall. Driving through town, Dillinger nervously watches under his fedora. The mechanic sits beside him while his accomplice and the deputy are in back. Dillinger stops at a red light where more Guardsmen talk, their guns strapped.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He forcefully propels Cahoon toward the door, and the large, hulking inmate follows closely behind, maintaining a menacing presence. Dillinger takes cover, pressing himself against the wall to remain hidden. Cahoon cautiously peers through the bars. As the guard proceeds to open the door, Dillinger swiftly pushes Cahoon aside and forcefully slams Brian against the wall. The hulking inmate covers Cahoon's mouth to muffle any sound. With quick, decisive movements, Dillinger spins Brian around toward the next door, aggressively pointing the waxy weapon at his back in a threatening manner. Brian stubbornly resists, but Dillinger intensifies the threat by jabbing him with the gun. He then forcefully shoves Brian toward his hulking accomplice, who continues to firmly restrain Cahoon. Dillinger’s eyes dart toward the door as he prepares to make his next move. With a powerful kick, he flings it open, striking the guard squarely in the face. Max tumbles headlong down a flight of stairs with Dillinger in close pursuit. His accomplice raises a pipe in his hand, keeping it poised as he pushes Brian, ensuring he remains behind Dillinger. Using Max's confiscated keys, Dillinger efficiently unlocks the next barred door, then manipulates Max to stand in front of a solid metal door. Peering through a small opening, the guard on the other side cautiously unlocks it. As the door swings open, Dillinger seizes the opportunity to shove the guard abruptly into Max, while his accomplice delivers a forceful blow to Brian with the pipe. Dillinger hastily charges into the office, brandishing his gun against the warden's neck. He coerces the warden into the hall, while his steadfast accomplice restrains a nearby deputy. With the barrel of his gun pressed firmly into the warden's neck, Dillinger compels the warden to spin the combination dial on a safe door. Stepping inside the compact, closet-sized safe, Dillinger discards his fake, waxy gun and seizes a real pistol from the wall. Emerging with a rifle in hand, he passes a machine gun to his accomplice. As the accomplice takes the lead, guiding the warden away, Dillinger quickly grabs a hat and coat from a nearby rack. He dons them with purpose, tossing a jacket to the other inmate, who quickly grabs a hat from the rack before ushering the deputy out, trailing behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised and at the ready, Dillinger cautiously opens a sturdy metal door in the hallway, closely followed by his accomplice, who keeps one hand firmly clutching the deputy between them. They swiftly maneuver their way into a garage, where a mechanic is busy working on a police car. Dillinger wastes no time, reaching into one of the cars and ripping out its ignition wires. He strides purposefully to the Ford V8, ready for their getaway. Outside, four officers casually converse on a porch, their guns negligently perched against their shoulders. The sleek Ford glides past undetected, slipping by in the alley beside them. At the front of the jailhouse, National Guardsmen loiter near their sandbag wall. As Dillinger drives through the town, he nervously shifts his gaze, eyes scanning under the brim of his tipped-down fedora. Seated beside him is the jailhouse mechanic, while his accomplice rides in the back alongside the deputy. Dillinger's eyes catch sight of three National Guardsmen strolling leisurely down the sidewalk. He comes to a stop at a red traffic light, stationed on a corner where more National Guardsmen stand clustered together, engaged in conversation, their guns securely strapped over their shoulders.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a forceful motion, he propels Cahoon toward the door, and the large, hulking inmate follows closely behind, maintaining a menacing presence that lingers heavily in the air. Dillinger, aware of the need for stealth, strategically takes cover, pressing himself tightly against the wall to remain hidden from view. Meanwhile, Cahoon, with a blend of hesitation and caution, peers slowly through the bars. As the guard proceeds with the action of opening the door, Dillinger swiftly pushes Cahoon aside and forcefully slams Brian against the unyielding wall. The hulking inmate quickly covers Cahoon's mouth, effectively muffling any possible sound he might make. With quick, decisive movements, Dillinger spins Brian around toward the adjacent door, aggressively pointing the waxy weapon at his back in an unmistakably threatening manner. Brian, showing stubborn resistance, pushes back, but Dillinger intensifies the threat by jabbing him again with the gun. He then forcefully shoves Brian toward his hulking accomplice, who continues to firmly restrain Cahoon with an unyielding grip. Dillinger's eyes dart toward the door as he mentally prepares to make his next crucial move. With a powerful kick, he flings it open, the door striking the guard squarely in the face with a harsh, resounding impact. Max, caught off guard, tumbles headlong down a flight of stairs with Dillinger in close and relentless pursuit. His hulking accomplice, ever the vigilant partner, raises a pipe in hand, keeping it poised as he pushes Brian, ensuring that he remains behind Dillinger. Using Max's confiscated keys, Dillinger efficiently and quickly unlocks the next barred door, then manipulates Max to stand in front of a solid metal door. Peering through a small, narrow opening, the guard on the other side cautiously unlocks it. As the door swings open, Dillinger seizes the opportunity to abruptly shove the guard into Max, while his accomplice delivers a forceful blow to Brian with the pipe. Dillinger hastily charges into the office, brandishing his gun with authority against the warden's neck, coercing him into the hall, while his steadfast accomplice restrains a nearby deputy with unwavering strength. With the barrel of his gun pressed firmly into the warden's neck, Dillinger compels the warden to spin the combination dial on a safe door. Stepping inside the compact, closet-sized safe, Dillinger discards his fake, waxy gun, seizing a real pistol from the wall. Emerging confidently with a rifle in hand, he passes a machine gun to his accomplice. As the accomplice takes the lead, guiding the warden away with calculated precision, Dillinger quickly grabs a hat and coat from a nearby rack. He dons them with purpose, tossing a jacket to the other inmate, who hurriedly grabs a hat from the rack before ushering the deputy out, trailing behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised and at the ready, Dillinger cautiously opens a sturdy metal door in the hallway, moving forward with determination, closely followed by his accomplice, who keeps one hand firmly clutching the deputy between them. They swiftly maneuver their way into a spacious garage, where a mechanic is busy working on a police car. Dillinger wastes no time, reaching decisively into one of the cars and ripping out its ignition wires. He strides purposefully to the waiting Ford V8, ready for their getaway. Outside, four officers casually converse on a porch, their guns negligently perched against their shoulders, oblivious to the unfolding events. The sleek Ford glides past them undetected, slipping silently by in the alley beside them. At the front of the jailhouse, National Guardsmen loiter near their sandbag wall, unaware of the drama unfolding within. As Dillinger drives through the town, he nervously shifts his gaze, eyes scanning under the brim of his tipped-down fedora. Seated beside him is the jailhouse mechanic, while his accomplice rides in the back alongside the deputy. Dillinger's eyes catch sight of three National Guardsmen strolling leisurely down the sidewalk. He comes to a cautious stop at a red traffic light, stationed at a corner where more National Guardsmen stand clustered together, engrossed in conversation, their guns securely strapped over their shoulders, oblivious to the fugitives nearby.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He firmly pushes Cahoon toward the door, propelling him forward with determined urgency, while the hulking inmate shadows closely behind them with a watchful and imposing presence. Dillinger skillfully conceals himself against a wall, making himself hidden from view. Cahoon cautiously peers through the bars, scrutinizing the scene that unfolds before him. As the guard dutifully opens the door, Dillinger seizes the moment to abruptly shove Cahoon aside and forcefully slam Brian into the unforgiving wall. The hulking inmate swiftly covers Cahoon's mouth, effectively muffling any protest. Dillinger deftly spins Brian around to face the next door, pressing the waxy weapon firmly against Brian's back to assert control. When Brian exhibits defiance, Dillinger resolutely prods him with the gun, compelling compliance. He then thrusts Brian toward his hulking accomplice, who continues to restrain Cahoon with unwavering grip. Dillinger casts an assessing glance at the door, gathering momentum, and delivers a forceful kick that sends it crashing open, striking the guard squarely in the face. As Max tumbles down a flight of stairs, Dillinger remains close on his heels, descending swiftly. His accomplice elevates a pipe with intent, keeping it poised as he maneuvers Brian into position behind Dillinger. With Max's keys now in hand, Dillinger deftly unlocks the next barred door, propelling Max to stand before the imposing metal door that lies ahead. The guard stationed on the other side peers through cautiously, then moves to unlock it. As the door swings open, Dillinger seizes the opportunity, shoving the guard forcefully into Max, creating chaos. Meanwhile, his accomplice delivers a calculated blow to Brian with the pipe. Dillinger quickly enters the office, brandishing his gun menacingly to the warden's throat, compelling compliance. He propels the warden into the hallway, all while his accomplice maintains a firm grip on a deputy to ensure control. As Dillinger aggressively presses the gun barrel into the warden's neck, the warden, under duress, spins the dial on a safe door, opening it. Dillinger steps confidently into the cramped space of the safe, discarding the fake, waxy weapon with disdain, and selects a pistol from the wall with precise intent. He emerges from the safe, now armoured with a rifle, and hands a machine gun to his accomplice, creating an air of intimidation. The warden casts a wary glance backward as the accomplice leads him away from the scene. Dillinger, maintaining focus, retrieves a hat and coat from a nearby rack, slipping them on with practiced ease. He tosses a jacket to the other inmate, who deftly catches it while also grabbing a hat from the rack, subtly transforming their appearances. The accomplice skillfully ushers the deputy out, making them appear as if they belong, trailing Dillinger's lead. With his rifle held at the ready, Dillinger cautiously nudges open a metal door in the corridor, while his accomplice trails closely, one hand securely clutching the deputy to ensure cooperation. They advance into a garage, where a mechanic dutifully works on a police car, oblivious to the unfolding escape. Dillinger decisively reaches into one of the vehicles, tearing out its ignition wires with deliberate action. He strides confidently to the Ford V8, his target for escape. Outside, four officers engrossed in conversation on a porch remain blissfully unaware, their guns lazily perched against their shoulders as the sleek Ford glides by undetected in the adjacent alley. At the front of the jailhouse, National Guardsmen linger beside their sandbag barricade, casually passing time. As Dillinger steers the car through the town, he warily scans the surroundings, his eyes darting nervously beneath the lowered brim of his fedora. Seated beside him, the jailhouse mechanic maintains an uneasy silence, while his accomplice occupies the rear with the deputy, ensuring compliance. Dillinger's attention sharpens as he notices three National Guardsmen ambling down the sidewalk, representing potential obstacles. He halts briefly for a red traffic light at a corner where additional National Guardsmen congregate, engrossed in conversation, their guns strapped loosely over their shoulders, as the tension of the escape momentarily eases.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Dillinger maneuvers Cahoon and the hulking inmate to the door, concealing himself as Cahoon checks the bars. When the guard opens the door, Dillinger swiftly incapacitates him, while the hulking inmate silences Cahoon. Dillinger then directs Brian with a waxy weapon, pushing him toward the accomplice who restrains Cahoon. Eyeing the door, Dillinger kicks it open, striking the guard, and follows Max down the stairs. As his accomplice holds Brian, Dillinger unlocks a barred door with Max's keys, forcing Max to the next door. After the guard inside unlocks it, Dillinger propels him into Max, allowing the accomplice to strike Brian with a pipe. Entering the office, Dillinger holds the warden at gunpoint, forcing him to open a safe. Discarding his fake gun, Dillinger arms himself with a pistol and rifle, handing a machine gun to his accomplice. They obtain hats and coats from a rack, with Dillinger donning his attire and tossing a jacket to the other inmate. Leading the deputy, they proceed through a metal door into a garage. Dillinger disables a car by ripping out ignition wires and moves to a Ford V8. Meanwhile, four officers outside remain unaware as the Ford drives by in an alley. Dillinger drives through the town, staying alert under his fedora's brim, while the mechanic and deputy accompany him and his accomplice. He navigates past National Guardsmen, pausing at a red light surrounded by armed guards, and continues through the town.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He pushes Cahoon toward the door of the notorious county jail, known for its high-security measures, and the hulking inmate follows close behind. Dillinger, a famous bank robber of the 1930s, hides against a wall. Cahoon peeks through the bars of the formidable cell door. As the guard opens the door, Dillinger pushes Cahoon away and slams Brian, the unsuspecting guard, into the wall. The hulking inmate covers Cahoon's mouth to muffle any cries for help. Dillinger spins Brian to the next door, pointing the waxy weapon, fashioned to look like a real gun, at his back. Brian refuses to comply. Dillinger pokes Brian with the gun, determined to move forward. He shoves Brian to his hulking accomplice, who still restrains Cahoon. Dillinger eyes the massive, reinforced door. He kicks it open and hits the guard in the face. Max, the guard, tumbles down a flight of stairs with Dillinger close behind. His accomplice holds a makeshift pipe weapon in his raised hand as he pushes Brian behind Dillinger. Using the heavy ring of Max's keys, Dillinger opens the next barred door then forces Max to stand in front of a metal door. The guard on the other side, hearing the commotion, peeks through then unlocks it. As he opens the door, Dillinger shoves him into Max, and his accomplice hits Brian with his pipe. Dillinger, now inside, rushes into the office and holds his gun to the warden's neck, a man known for his strict adherence to prison protocol. He pushes the warden into the hall while his accomplice restrains a deputy. As Dillinger jams the barrel of his gun into the warden's neck, the warden, under duress, spins the dial on a safe door. Dillinger steps into the closet-sized safe, discards his fake, waxy gun, and grabs a pistol from the wall stocked with firearms for emergencies. He steps out with a rifle and hands a machine gun, a symbol of the gang's audacity, to his accomplice. The warden glances back as the accomplice leads him away. Dillinger grabs a hat and coat from a nearby rack, disguises typical of his heists. He puts them on and tosses a jacket to the other inmate, who grabs a hat from the rack as he ushers the deputy out behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised, Dillinger cautiously opens a metal door in the hallway. His accomplice follows close behind with one hand clutching the deputy between them. They make their way into a garage where a mechanic is engrossed in repairing a police car, essential for maintaining the jail's fleet. Dillinger reaches into one of the cars and rips out its ignition wires, a tactic to prevent pursuit. He strides to the Ford V8, a powerful vehicle favored for its speed and agility. Outside, four officers talk to each other on a porch, their guns perched casually against their shoulders, oblivious to the unfolding escape. The sleek Ford passes undetected in the alley beside them. At the front of the jailhouse, the National Guardsmen mill about by their sandbag wall, part of the heightened security due to recent criminal activities. As Dillinger drives through the town, he nervously shifts his eyes back under the tipped-down brim of his fedora, a classic accessory for blending in. The jailhouse mechanic sits beside him while his accomplice rides in back with the deputy, maintaining control over their captive. Dillinger notices three National Guardsmen strolling down the sidewalk, a frequent sight in towns on high alert. He stops for a red traffic light on a corner where more National Guardsmen stand together talking, their guns strapped over their shoulders, unaware of the notorious criminal in their midst.

Dillinger steps into the closetsized safe discards his fake waxy gun and grabs a pistol from the wall. He steps out with a rifle and hands a machine gun to his accomplice. The warden glances back as the accomplice leads him away. Dillinger grabs a hat and coat from a nearby rack. He puts them on and tosses a jacket to the other inmate who grabs a hat from the rack as he ushers the deputy out behind Dillinger. With his rifle raised Dillinger cautiously opens a metal door in the hallway. His accomplice follows close behind with one hand clutching the deputy between them. They make their way into a garage where a mechanic works on a police car. Dillinger reaches into one of the cars and rips out its ignition wires. He strides to the Ford V8. Outside. four officers talk to each other on a porch their guns perched casually against their shoulders. The sleek Ford passes undetected in the alley beside them. At the front of the jailhouse the National Guardsmen mill about by their sandbag wall. As Dillinger drives through the town he nervously shifts his eyes back under the tippeddown brim of his fedora. The jailhouse mechanic sits beside him while his accomplice rides in back with the deputy. Dillinger notices three National Guardsmen strolling down the sidewalk. He stops for a red traffic light on a corner where more National Guardsmen stand together talking their guns strapped over their shoulders.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He pushes Cahoon toward the door and the hulking inmate follows close behind. Dillinger hides against a wall. Cahoon peaks through the bars. As the guard opens the door Dillinger pushes Cahoon away and slams Brian into the wall. The hulking inmate covers Cahoon's mouth. Dillinger spins Brian to the next door pointing the waxy weapon at his back. Brian refuses. Dillinger pokes Brian with the gun. He shoves Brian to his hulking accomplice who still restrains Cahoon. Dillinger eyes the door. He kicks it open and hits the guard in the face. Max tumbles down a flight of stairs with Dillinger close behind. His accomplice holds a pipe in his raised hand as he pushes Brian behind Dillinger. Using Max's keys Dillinger opens the next barred door then forces Max to stand in front of a metal door. The guard on the other side peeks through then unlocks it. As he opens the door Dillinger shoves him into Max and his accomplice hits Brian with his pipe. Dillinger rushes into the office and holds his gun to the warden's neck. He pushes the warden into the hall while his accomplice restrains a deputy. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The catapult launches Henderson toward the window, and the towering gardener skips closely behind. Winchester crouches beneath a statue. Henderson peers through the curtains. As the chef swings the window open, Winchester catapults Henderson away and smashes Charlie into a statue. The towering gardener muffles Henderson's cries. Winchester twirls Charlie to the revolving door, brandishing the rubbery utensil at his shoulder. Charlie declines. Winchester prods Charlie with the spoon. He nudges Charlie to his towering helper, who still stifles Henderson. Winchester gazes at the window. He swings it open and taps the chef on the nose. Jack somersaults down a garden path with Winchester skipping closely behind. His helper grips a hose in his lifted arm as he nudges Charlie behind Winchester. Using Jack's pliers, Winchester releases the next wooden window then coaxes Jack to pose in front of a stone gate. The chef on the opposite side peeks through then unlatches it. As he swings the gate open, Winchester propels him into Jack, and his helper taps Charlie with his hose. Winchester dashes into the shed and presses his spoon to the gardener's collar. He shoves the gardener into the yard while his helper grips a painter. As Winchester wedges the end of his utensil into the gardener's collar, the gardener twirls the knob on a cabinet door. Winchester marches into the closet-sized cabinet, discards his fake, rubbery spoon, and seizes a spatula from the shelf. He emerges with a hammer and hands a chainsaw to his helper. The gardener glances back as the helper guides him away. Winchester seizes a scarf and boots from a nearby hook. He dons them and tosses a mitten to the other gardener, who seizes a scarf from the hook as he guides the painter out behind Winchester. With his hammer lifted, Winchester gingerly pushes a stone gate in the garden path. His helper skips closely behind with one hand clasping the painter between them. They advance into a workshop where a builder hammers on a tractor. Winchester delves into one of the tractors and pulls out its steering cables. He meanders to the Toyota Camry. Outside, four artists converse on a veranda, their brushes balanced leisurely against their elbows. The glossy Camry glides unnoticed in the lane beside them. At the facade of the farmhouse, the Farmhands loiter by their wooden fence. As Winchester cruises through the plaza, he warily flicks his eyes back under the tilted-up fringe of his cap. The farmhouse builder sits beside him while his helper lounges in the rear with the painter. Winchester spots three Farmhands ambling down the footpath. He halts for a yellow traffic sign at an intersection where more Farmhands stand in assembly conversing, their brushes slung across their elbows.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dillinger and his hulking accomplice execute a prison break. Pushing Cahoon aside, Dillinger hides, waiting for the guard Brian to open the door. He then attacks Brian and pushes him to his accomplice while using a fake gun to control the situation. After kicking open a door and overcoming guards, Dillinger accesses the warden's safe, discards the fake weapon, and arms himself with a pistol and rifle, giving a machine gun to his accomplice. Dillinger dons a disguise and, along with his accomplice holding a deputy, cautiously exits into a garage. There, they commandeer a police car, passing undetected past officers and National Guardsmen. Dillinger nervously drives through the town with his accomplice and prisoners, trying to avoid attention from the guardsmen on patrol.
